intro: Zygotritonia benishangulana, commonly known as the Ethiopian buttercup, is a flowering plant native to Ethiopia. It belongs to the family Ranunculaceae and is characterized by its showy, yellow flowers with a distinctive cup-shaped structure. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments, such as forest floors or rocky areas. Its leaves are palmately divided, and it produces small, hairy seeds that are dispersed by wind. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and potentially endangered species.
